content.question: Block <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> slides rightward on the floor toward an ideal spring attached to block <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, as shown. At time <math alttext="t sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, block <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> reaches the spring and starts compressing it as block <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> also starts to slide to the right. At a later time, <math alttext="t sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, block <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> loses contact with the spring. Both blocks slide with negligible friction. Taking rightward as positive, which pair of graphs could represent the acceleration of block <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> and the center-of-mass acceleration of the two-block system?
